Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Chuckle \Chuc"kle\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Chuckled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Chuckling}.] [From 1st {Chuck}.] 1. To call, as a hen her chickens; to cluck. [Obs.] --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. To fondle; to cocker. [Obs.] --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chuckle \Chuc"kle\, n. A short, suppressed laugh; the expression of satisfaction, exultation, or derision. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chuckle \Chuc"kle\, v. i. [From 1st {Chuck}.] To laugh in a suppressed or broken manner, as expressing inward satisfaction, exultation, or derision. [1913 Webster]
chuckle n : a soft partly suppressed laugh [syn: {chortle}] v : laugh quietly or with restraint [syn: {chortle}, {laugh softly}]
